subject: ACTION: Approve LOGCAP Contract Extension - $47M
bodyPreview: Sir, the LOGCAP V contract for theater logistics support is set to expire on 31 December. We require your approval to execute a 6-month extension valued at $47 million. This contract provides critical support for ongoing operations in theater including base life support services, transportation, and logistics management. Decision required NLT 20 NOV to process paperwork and prevent service disruption on 1 JAN.

body.content:
Sir,

The LOGCAP V contract for theater logistics support is set to expire on 31 December 2025. We require your approval to execute a 6-month extension valued at $47 million.

Contract Details:

  • Contract Number: W52P1J-19-D-0001 (Task Order 0045)
  • Contractor: Fluor Federal Solutions LLC
  • Current Period of Performance: 1 Jan 2024 - 31 Dec 2025
  • Proposed Extension: 1 Jan 2026 - 30 Jun 2026 (6 months)
  • Extension Value: $47,250,000
  • Contract Type: Cost-Plus-Award-Fee (CPAF)

Services Provided:

This contract provides essential theater logistics support including:

  1. Base Life Support (BLS):
    • Dining facility operations (3 DFACs serving 8,000+ personnel daily)
    • Laundry and textile services
    • Billeting management
    • Morale, welfare and recreation (MWR) support
    • Facility maintenance and custodial services
  2. Transportation Services:
    • Line haul trucking operations
    • Material handling equipment operations
    • Warehouse management
    • Distribution center operations
  3. Logistics Management:
    • Supply chain visibility tools
    • Inventory management
    • Asset tracking systems
    • Quality assurance/quality control

Justification for Extension:

  • Mission Critical: Services are essential to ongoing operations; no organic capability to perform these functions
  • No Alternative Sources: Current contractor is the only entity with in-theater infrastructure, trained workforce, and security clearances to perform work
  • Continuity of Operations: Competitive rebid process requires 9-12 months; extension allows proper acquisition timeline without service disruption
  • Cost Effectiveness: Pricing remains consistent with current contract rates (verified by independent government cost estimate)
  • Performance: Contractor has consistently met or exceeded performance standards (current CPAF score: 94/100)

Financial Analysis:

Service CategoryMonthly Cost6-Month Total
Base Life Support$4,125,000$24,750,000
Transportation$2,375,000$14,250,000
Logistics Management$1,125,000$6,750,000
Contingency (5%)$250,000$1,500,000
TOTAL$7,875,000$47,250,000

Price Reasonableness:

  • Independent Government Cost Estimate (IGCE): $46.8M - $48.2M
  • Proposed price falls within IGCE range
  • No price increase from current contract rates (adjusted only for inflation: 2.1%)
  • Comparison with other theater LOGCAP contracts shows pricing is consistent and reasonable

Funding:

  • Funding Source: Operations and Maintenance, Army (OMA) FY2026
  • Budget Line: Theater Operations Support
  • Obligation Authority: Available and approved by ASA(FM&C)
  • Fiscal Law Compliance: Verified by Staff Judge Advocate

Coordination Completed:

  • ✓ Resource Management (G-8): Funding certified
  • ✓ Staff Judge Advocate: Legal review complete - no issues identified
  • ✓ Contracting Officer: Recommends approval
  • ✓ Senior Contracting Official (AMC): Endorses extension
  • ✓ Inspector General: No conflicts of interest identified

Risk Assessment:

Risk of Approval: LOW

  • Contractor has proven track record
  • Pricing is fair and reasonable
  • Proper competition will occur for follow-on contract

Risk of Non-Approval: HIGH

  • Service disruption beginning 1 JAN 2026
  • 8,000+ personnel affected (no dining, laundry, facilities support)
  • Mission impact: Unable to sustain current operational tempo
  • Emergency contracting would cost 15-20% more
  • Safety and morale concerns for deployed personnel

Timeline:

  • 20 NOV 2025: Decision required from your office
  • 22-25 NOV: Prepare modification documents
  • 26 NOV: Submit to DCMA for review
  • 2-6 DEC: Final coordination and signature authority
  • 9 DEC: Award contract modification
  • 10-20 DEC: Contractor transition planning
  • 1 JAN 2026: Extended services begin

Competitive Follow-On Procurement:

Concurrent with this extension, we are initiating the competitive procurement process for a new long-term contract:

  • Sources Sought Notice: Published 15 NOV 2025
  • Draft RFP Release: January 2026
  • Final RFP Release: March 2026
  • Proposals Due: May 2026
  • Award Target: September 2026
  • Performance Start: 1 July 2026 (allows 30-day transition)

Recommendation:

Based on mission requirements, contractor performance, pricing reasonableness, and risk analysis, I strongly recommend approval of this 6-month contract extension.

Action Required:

Please indicate your approval or disapproval by replying to this email NLT 20 NOV 2025, 1700 EST. If you approve, state:

and I will proceed with processing the contract modification.

If you have questions or require additional information, please contact me directly or the contracting officer (POC information below).

Attached Documents:

  1. Contract Extension Justification Memo (15 pages)
  2. Independent Government Cost Estimate (IGCE)
  3. Price Analysis and Comparison
  4. Legal Review Memorandum (SJA)
  5. Contractor Past Performance Summary
  6. Risk Assessment Matrix
  7. Budget Certification (G-8)

All documents are UNCLASSIFIED and available for immediate review.

Respectfully,

BG Amanda Foster
Deputy Commander for Contracting
US Army Materiel Command (AMC)
Office: (256) 450-XXXX
Mobile: (256) 555-XXXX
amanda.foster@amc.army.mil

Contracting Officer POC:
Mr. David Reynolds
Senior Contracting Officer
Phone: (256) 450-XXXX
Email: david.reynolds@amc.army.mil
